item.title: Ten Children Stabbed By Man At China School
item.description: Six boys and four girls are in hospital receiving treatment following the attack outside a primary school in the city of Haikou.

item.title: At Least 30 People Killed In Somalia Bombings
item.description: An al Shabaab suicide bomber targets a busy road junction while a second bomb explodes at a nearby restaurant.

item.title: Protests As Pakistan 'Hero' Assassin Is Hanged
item.description: The execution of Mumtaz Qadri, hailed a hero for killing a politician seeking reform of blasphemy law, sparks security fears.

item.title: White House Race Breaking Rules Of Politics
item.description: The rules of political gravity in the US appear to have been upended ahead of Super Tuesday, when a dozen states go to the polls.

item.title: Oscars 2016: Leonardo DiCaprio Wins Best Actor
item.description: After being nominated five times, DiCaprio takes home his first Oscar - but The Revenant misses out on the best picture gong.

item.title: Oscars 2016: The Full List Of Winners
item.description: Spotlight, Leonardo DiCaprio and Brie Larson take top prizes but Mad Max: Fury Road is the big winner in the technical categories.

item.title: Irish PM Vows To Carry On Despite Losses
item.description: Once the final election results are known, Ireland's main parties will have until 10 March to form a new government.

item.title: Can Ireland's Ancient Rivals Bury The Hatchet?
item.description: Fine Gael and Fianna Fail were on opposite sides during the civil war, but now the two parties have to contemplate a coalition.

item.title: Policewoman Killed On First Day Of New Job
item.description: Officer Ashley Guindon, who was sworn in on Friday, had just returned to policing after leaving the force a few years ago.

item.title: Ex-Greek Minister Varoufakis To Advise Corbyn
item.description: The self-described "erratic Marxist" is to advise the Labour Party "in some capacity", Jeremy Corbyn confirms.
